issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

This message was automatically generated.
There was no unit test failure even though it return -1. I think it is something unrelated to this patch.
[~haibo.chen], do you plan to include this for 2.9.0 as well as it looks relevant?
Yeah. I can take a look at backporting this into branch-2 then 2.9

Looks good overall.  A few minor things:
# Can you add Javadoc to {{AbstractYarnScheduler#killContainer}}?
# The arguments for {{completedContainer}} in {{FairScheduler#killContainer}} can fit on one line.
# I'm not an expert here, but it seems funny to me that we're preempting a container when we kill it; it seems especially strange if this were to happen when preemption were turned off...

Thanks [~rkanter] for the review! killContainer() is solely called in TestAMRestart to simulate AM container failures. In that sense, none of the available ContainerExitStatus matches that intension nicely. The closest to the method name is probably KILLED_BY_RESOURCEMANAGER if we ignore the real intension. Will change the status to that in FairScheduler and address the other comments.

Committed the patch to branch-2.9, branch-2, branch-3.0, trunk
[~subru] Let me know if it is still ok to cherry-pick this into 2.9.0.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #13212 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/13212/])

Sounds good. Thanks for the update!
